result.execSummary:
The defendant William Earl Singleton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, William Earl Singleton was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William Earl Singleton is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • William Earl Singleton was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • William Earl Singleton was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • William Earl Singleton was found guilty of Aggravated Battery-Elderly, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO COUNTS ONE AND TWO:  Pay all applicable costs, fees, assessments and surcharges as stated in count three.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts two and three, and any other sentence.  Credit for 153 days.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one and three, and with any other sentence. Credit for 153 days.

Pay all costs, assessments, victim witness surcharge, DNA surcharge.
AS TO COUNTS ONE, TWO AND THREE:  All to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one and two, and with any other sentence.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all approriate costs.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; also advised that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Earl Singleton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (11 pages) commencing NOVEMBER 19, 2015 received and filed. kl
Counts one and two, now printed.
Count three.

Defendant William Earl Singleton in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant William Earl Singleton in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements to the court by parties.
AS TO COUNT 1:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction, concurrent with counts 2 and 3 and with any other sentence with credit for 153 days time served.  
AS TO COUNT 2:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, concurrent with counts 1 and 3 and with any other sentence with credit for 153 days time served.  
As to counts 1 and 2:   The court orders defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees, assessments and surcharges  as a condition of Extended Supervision as imposed in count 3 and failure to do so will result in entry of civil judgment.
AS TO COUNT 3:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 60 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 153 days time served, concurrent with counts 1 and 3 and with any other sentence.  CONFINEMENT of 30 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 30 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution AS TO COUNTS 1,2, AND 3, be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant is remanded.
Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Credit Sheet; Ineligible Voting Notice; Written explanation of determinate sentence

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 669
cf
COUNTS 1,2,3,4

Defendant William Earl Singleton in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant William Earl Singleton in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury in the box at 9:35am.  Testimony of PO Neuzerling resumed.  Sworn for the state: Debora G; PO John Kohler.  State rests.  Jury out of the box at 10:30am.  Defense motion as to directed verdict is denied.  Colloquy between the court and defendant as to his decision NOT to testify in his own behalf.  Jury instructions placed on the record.
Jury in the box at 10:55am.  State rests.  Recalled for the defense:  PO Neuzerling.  Defense rests.  No rebuttal is presented by the state.  Testimony closed.    Court instructs the jury.  Jury is released for lunch and directed to return at 1:30pm for closing arguments.
COURT REPORTER KATHLEEN WORDEN
All parties present in court.  Jury in the box at 1:45pm. Court gave additional instructions to jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Rebuttal argument by the state.  Court charged the jury. Jury retired at the hour of 2:35pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Lee and Spottek who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Defense is moving for a directed verdict as to count 2 as the location of where the alleged DISORDERLY CONDUCT took place is unclear.  Court will take under advisement.  Parties are in agreement that exhibits may be sent upon request.  Jury requested exhibits (1-7) which were sent to jury room.          
All parties present in court.  At the hour of 4:20pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson (#15), brought in the following verdicts:
Count 1:We, the jury, find the defendant GUILTY of Battery
Count 2:We, the jury, find the defendant GUILTY of Disorderly Conduct
Count 3:We, the jury, find the defendant GUILTY of Aggravated Battery-Elderly
Count 4:We, the jury, find the defendant NOT GUILTY 
Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed.  Defense renews motion as to COUNT 2, which is denied by the court.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdicts as to counts 1,2,3 and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court entered judgment of acquittal as to COUNT 4. Court ordered entry of judgments of conviction.
PSI is waived.  Court adjourns sentencing to 11-19-2015 at 8:15.  Defendant is remanded.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant William Earl Singleton in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant William Earl Singleton in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are prepared to proceed to trial.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  11:35am.  Court released jurors at Noon and directed them to return at 1:00pm for conclusion of voir dire.
COURT REPORTER RISA KRAMER
Jury panel in box at 1:20pm and voir dire continued. TWELVE good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Rashaa G.; Eugene G. PO James Neuzertling . 
Exhibits 1 through 7  received.  Court recesses for the evening.  Jury out of the box at 4:45pm.  Court directs the jury not to conduct any independent investigation and orders them to return at 9:15 on 10-6-2015.
State's Motion in Limine and Witness List filed.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant William Earl Singleton not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's appearance is waived.
Defendant has a revocation hearing set for mid-October.  The state is revoking all offers on today's date.  Case remains in trial posture.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant William Earl Singleton not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Demand for Speedy Trial was entered on 7-15-2015.  Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 38 on 9-17-2015 at 8:15 and Jury Trial on 10-5-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld
Scheduling conference scheduled for 07-23-2015 at 08:30 am.
Defense counsel enters a Speedy trial demand.

BRANCH PE for BRANCH 4:

Defendant William Earl Singleton in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant William Earl Singleton in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer James Neuzerling.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 4 for scheduling conference.
Clerk:  jms
Due to branch 4 in trial, Preliminary Hearing transferred to Prelim Court.   mld

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant William Earl Singleton not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Due to the time of day and today's court calendar, the Preliminary Hearing is not able to be commenced in a timely manner. Both the State and Defense Counsel have no objection to an adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 07-09-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.
Court amends bail to $499 cash - all other bail conditions remain as previously set.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant William Earl Singleton not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State is not prepared to proceed to preliminary hearing on today's date and requests adjournment.
Court will modify bail and orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing.  Court is not in session on the next date; parties are advised case will be adjourned to Branch PE for the preliminary hearing.
Clerk:  jms
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Rashaad G; Eugene G.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant William Earl Singleton in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant William Earl Singleton in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 4.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of Not Guilty as to Count 1 and Count 2.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
